page.title: 05THE SPONSORED SWIM
page.content: On Wednesday, 29th. May 1985, Brian Hunt, John Bruneau, Matthew Eglise, David Reid and Richard Webb with Mrs Hunt and Mr Rumens, all representing Kilndown Primary School, took part in a Sponsored Swim for the British Heart Foundation. It was held at the St. Johns Pool in Tunbridge Wells, where the school swims every Tuesday of term time. We raised 365 pounds. On Friday, 5th. July, Mr Ken Boughton and Mr Vernon Rowe of the Tunbridge Wells Branch came to school and gave out certificates, badges and T-shirts. Richard, Brian, Mrs Hunt and Mr Rumens got T-shirts. The Tunbridge Wells area has raised 3000 pounds so far. The School may win a shield for the largest amount raised by a school in the Tunbridge Wells area.
